questions.question: Which term describes a situation where a process is indefinitely waiting to acquire resources that are held by other processes?
If a process requires 15 KB of memory and the system has a page size of 4 KB, how many pages does the process need?
A system has 16 pages and each page is 8 KB in size. If the page table has 256 entries, what is the size of the page table?
What happens in a system when a process cannot get enough CPU time due to other processes with higher priority?

options.B: The process enters a deadlock state

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm is designed to minimize the average time a process waits before it starts execution?
What is the primary objective of the Banker's algorithm in deadlock avoidance?
In the context of process management, what is a race condition?

options.A: A condition where multiple processes access shared resources without synchronization
options.B: A condition where processes compete for CPU time
options.C: A condition where processes are scheduled in a round-robin manner
options.D: A condition where processes are waiting for I/O operations to complete

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm is designed to give equal CPU time to all processes in a multi-user system?
In virtual memory systems, what is the primary purpose of the page table entry (PTE)?

options.C: To link to the next page table

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the File Allocation Table (FAT) in file management?

options.D: To keep track of file cluster allocations

questions.question: Which process synchronization primitive allows multiple processes to enter a critical section at once but limits the number that can enter?
In the context of memory management, what is the 'thrashing' phenomenon?

options.A: A condition of high disk I/O activity
options.C: A condition of optimal page replacement
options.D: A condition of low CPU utilization

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Directory Entry Block (DEB) in file management?

options.D: To track file location on disk

questions.question: Which algorithm is used to replace a page in the page table when there is a page fault and selects the victim page based on its past usage history?
What is the primary purpose of a wait-for graph in deadlock detection?

options.A: To represent the execution order of processes

questions.question: In CPU scheduling, which algorithm aims to execute the process with the highest priority first?
What is the main goal of file system journaling in disk management?

options.C: To prevent data loss due to crashes

questions.question: In memory management, what is the role of the Memory Management Unit (MMU)?

options.C: To translate virtual addresses to physical addresses

questions.question: In the context of file management, what is the purpose of a file descriptor?

options.D: To track file location on disk

questions.question: What is the primary function of a condition variable in synchronization?

options.C: To allow threads to wait for a specific condition to be met
